results.title: The Wooing of Jared Kushner: How the Saudis Got a Friend in the White House
results.abstract: The crown prince of Saudi Arabia cultivated Mr. Kushner’s friendship. The benefits to the U.S. are uncertain but it has paid off well for the Saudis.
results.byline: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK, BEN HUBBARD, MARK LANDLER and MARK MAZZETTI

multimedia.caption: Prince Mohammed bin Salman with Jared Kushner and his wife, Ivanka Trump, in Riyadh last year.

results.title: Prosecutors Say Trump Directed Illegal Payments During Campaign
results.abstract: Court filings revealed the most direct evidence to date tying Mr. Trump to potentially criminal conduct during the campaign involving hush payments to women.
results.byline: By SHARON LaFRANIERE, BENJAMIN WEISER and MAGGIE HABERMAN
des_facet: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

multimedia.caption: Michael Cohen, who was President Trump’s personal lawyer and fixer for more than a decade, leaving federal court in Manhattan last week after a guilty plea.
multimedia.copyright: Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times

results.title: Mueller Says Manafort Lied About Contacts With Trump Officials
results.abstract: The special counsel detailed his accusations that the former campaign chairman Paul Manafort lied to investigators.
results.byline: By ADAM GOLDMAN and SHARON LaFRANIERE
des_facet: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

multimedia.caption: The special counsel’s office has accused Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign chairman, of lying to prosecutors in a breach of his plea deal.

results.title: Mattis Erupts Over Niger Inquiry and Army Revisits Who Is to Blame
results.abstract: A senior officer who escaped punishment for the ambush that killed four American soldiers will be reprimanded. A junior officer’s reprimand is rescinded.
results.byline: By THOMAS GIBBONS-NEFF, HELENE COOPER and ERIC SCHMITT
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

multimedia.caption: Defense Secretary Jim Mattis was livid over decisions taken following an investigation into a 2017 ambush in Niger that killed four Americans on a Green Beret team.
Defense Secretary Jim Mattis was livid over decisions taken following an investigation into a 2017 ambush in Niger that killed four Americans on a Green Beret team.

results.title: Heather Nauert, State Dept. Spokeswoman, Said to Be Trump’s Pick for U.N. Post
results.abstract: Heather Nauert, a former Fox News anchor who has been the public face of the State Department since last year, would replace Nikki Haley as ambassador to the United Nations.
results.byline: By PETER BAKER and MAGGIE HABERMAN

multimedia.caption: Heather Nauert, the State Department spokeswoman, last year in Washington. If confirmed as the next United Nations envoy, she would be one of the most prominent promoters of the president’s “America First” foreign policy.
